intro: Pentanema, commonly known as the marsh mallow or false mallow, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Malvaceae. These plants are typically herbaceous and can be either annual or perennial, depending on the species. They are characterized by their hairy stems, alternate leaves, and showy, often pink or white flowers. Pentanema species are often found in wet or marshy habitats, thriving in moist environments. Their flowers are typically clustered in inflorescences and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
